mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the genus Oxyopomyrmex André, 1881 (Hymenoptera: Formicidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. Named after terra typica, Negeve desert in Israel.

Type locality:
Sede Boger, Negeve desert, Israel
.

FIGURES 31–33.
Oxyopomyrmex negevensis
sp. nov.
[holotype] 31 , Worker dorsal (scale bar = 1 mm). 32 , Worker lateral (scale bar = 1 mm). 33 , Worker head (scale bar = 0.5 mm).

subSubSection.paragraph: Biological data. Nothing is known about the biology of this species.

Differential diagnosis . Worker.
Oxyopomyrmex negevensis
is the only species known to have the first abdominal tergite bearing a dense layer of appressed microsetae. It belongs to the species group that has punctae on the dorsal surface of the pronotum. From
O. oculatus
it can be distinguished by the presence of vertical striae on the dorsal surface of the pronotum and longitudinal striae covering the entire frontal surface of the head; from
O. polybotesi
and
O. pygmalioni
it is distinguished by the presence of vertical striae and lack of rugosity on the dorsal surface of the pronotum; from
O. emeryi
it differs in the occurrence of longitudinal striae on the entire surface of the head and the rugae on the gena.
